docs.summary: Events fired by pricing plans.
description: Wix Pricing Plans events are fired in your site's backend when certain events occur with plans.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to pricing plan events.
> **Note**: Backend events don't work when previewing your site.
### Working with Pricing Plan Event Handlers
To add a pricing plan event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles pricing plan updates looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixPricingPlans_onPlanUpdated(event) { }
### Event Types
The Pricing Plans API events support different types of events:
| Type    | Examples                    | Event Object Properties              |
| Domain  | orderCreated, orderUpdated  | event.metadata and event.entity      |
| Action  | orderCanceled, orderResumed | event.metadata and event.data (to support custom payloads, which in our case is always the order)   |

> **Note**: Deprecated Paid Plans API functions trigger their original Paid Plans events. These events receive different event objects than the ones received when new Pricing Plans events are triggered. Make sure to accommodate for this in your code. Be aware of which events are being called and anticipate which event objects will be returned.
### Order Events and Corresponding Statuses
As an order progresses through its lifecycle from order creation until
order completion, various events get triggered. The order's status is
updated accordingly.
For example, the following describes the events and statuses for
an online, recurring order:
| Timeline of Events                     | Events Triggered                    | Order Status |
| 1) Online, recurring order created     | orderCreated                        | DRAFT        |
| 2) Payment arranged, start date later  | orderPurchased                      | PENDING      |
| 3) Start date arrives                  | orderStarted, billingCycleTriggered | ACTIVE       |
| 4) Next cycle arrives                  | billingCycleTriggered               | ACTIVE       |
| 5) Last cycle arrives                  | orderEnded                          | ENDED        |
The following flowchart details order events and statuses.
![Order Events](../assets/images/orderEvents.png)

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the pricing plan that was archived and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a pricing plan is archived.
description: The `onPlanArchived()` event handler runs when a pricing plan has been archived.
The received `PlanArchivedEvent`
object contains information about the pricing plan that was archived.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event triggered when a pricing plan is archived
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
*       "termsAndConditions": "Temporary access for visitors only. Not transferrable."

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the pricing plan that was created and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a pricing plan is created.
description: The `onPlanCreated()` event handler runs when a pricing plan has been created.
The received `PlanCreatedEvent`
object contains information about the pricing plan that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event triggered when a pricing plan is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a member purchases a plan.
description: The `onPlanPurchased()` event handler runs when a member purchases a pricing plan.
The received `PlanPurchasedEvent`
object contains order information about the plan, such as order ID,
until when the order is valid, and so on.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a pricing plan is purchased
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
// For inserting data about a plan transaction:
// Insert a title reflecting the type of transaction, and
/*  Event object for a free, one-month purchase, ordered using Thailand baht currency:
*   When the purchase is free, the `wixPayOrderId` is blank,
*   the `price.amount` is 0, and the paymentStatus is marked `PAID`.
*  Event object for a purchase that is valid until the user cancels:
*   When the purchase is valid until the user cancels, `validFor.forever` is true, and

extra.description:
This example adds purchased plan event data to a manually-created
 planEvents database. The database has a data field.

 When a plan is purchased and the onPlanPurchased event is triggered,
 the JSON format of the object is inserted into the data field.

params.doc: Information about the pricing plan that was updated and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a pricing plan is changed.
description: The `onPlanUpdated()` event handler runs when a pricing plan has changed.
The received `PlanUpdatedEvent`
object contains information about the pricing plan that was updated.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Plan ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

docs.summary: An object representing a new pricing plan order (subscription).

examples.title: An event when a pricing plan is purchased
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
// For inserting data about a plan transaction:
// Insert a title reflecting the type of transaction, and
/*  Event object for a free, one-month purchase, ordered using Thailand baht currency:
*   When the purchase is free, the `wixPayOrderId` is blank,
*   the `price.amount` is 0, and the paymentStatus is marked `PAID`.
*  Event object for a purchase that is valid until the user cancels:
*   When the purchase is valid until the user cancels, `validFor.forever` is true, and

extra.description:
This example adds purchased plan event data to a manually-created
 planEvents database. The database has a data field.

 When a plan is purchased and the onPlanPurchased event is triggered,
 the JSON format of the object is inserted into the data field.

members.name: id
members.doc: Order ID of the purchase of the plan, auto-generated when an order is created.

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc: Status of the payment for the plan. Can be `PAID`, `REFUNDED`, `FAILED`, `UNPAID`, and `PAYMENT_STATUS_UNDEFINED`.

members.name: validUntil
members.doc: Date and time until which the plan is valid.

members.name: price
members.doc: Object containing the price of the plan.

members.name: cancellationReason
members.doc:
If the plan is cancelled, the reason why. One of: 

 + `OWNER_CANCELED`: The owner cancelled.
 + `PAYMENT_PROVIDER_CANCELED`: The payment provider cancelled.
 + `PAYMENT_FAILED`: The payment failed.
 + `UOU_CANCELED`: The site member cancelled.
 + `CANCELLATION_REASON_UNDEFINED`: The reason is undefined.

members.name: cancellationInitiator
members.doc:
If the plan is cancelled, the cause of the cancellation. One of:

 + `"UNDEFINED"`: Cancellation initiator undefined.
 + `"OWNER"`: Order (subscription) was canceled by site owner. 
 + `"MEMBER"`: Order (subscription) was canceled by member.
 + `"PAYMENT_FAILURE"`: Subscription was canceled because of payment failure.
 + `"SETUP_FAILURE"`: Subscription was canceled because of payment setup failure.

members.name: validFrom
members.doc: Date and time from which the plan is valid.

members.name: wixPayOrderId
members.doc: ID of the plan for Wix Pay. If plan is free, this ID is blank.

members.name: recurring
members.doc: If the plan is recurring. If true, the price is deducted weekly, monthly, or yearly.

members.name: dateCreated
members.doc: Date and time the order was created.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the order. Can be `ACTIVE`, `PENDING`, `CANCELED`, `EXPIRED`, `PENDING_CANCELLATION`, and `ORDER_STATUS_UNDEFINED`.

members.name: roleID
members.doc: Role assigned after purchasing the plan.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID for the member who purchased the plan.

members.name: orderType
members.doc: How the plan was purchased, either `ONLINE` or `OFFLINE`.

members.name: validFor
members.doc: Object containing properties about how long the plan is valid.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: How many trial days were given to the subscriber of the plan. Available only for orders whose plans are recurring, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`.
